greeting: Hello, my name is Alan Borges dos Reis
about2: Hello, I'm Alan, a Software Engineering student at Unicesumar with a strong passion for DevOps. I started in the technology area in 2023 with game development in Unity, where I acquired knowledge in C#. Currently, I am focused on mastering DevOps best practices, with an emphasis on infrastructure automation using Terraform and container orchestration with Kubernetes. I have practical experience in CI/CD with Jenkins and am proficient in languages ​​such as Python and Bash. I constantly seek to improve my skills through personal projects.
Aws: AWS (Amazon Web Services) – Experience in configuration, management of EC2, S3, and RDS instances, as well as integration with other cloud services.
Docker: Docker: Containers, Docker Compose – Creation and orchestration of containers, optimization of development and production environments.
Kubernetes: Kubernetes: Creation and management of clusters, implementation of horizontal and vertical scalability strategies for mission-critical applications, using resources such as Deployments, Services, Ingresses and NetworkPolicies.
Ci/Cd: CI/CD: Implementation of robust CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins, GitLab CI and GitHub Actions, covering everything from construction and testing to deployment in various environments. Experience in unit, integration and end-to-end testing, using tools such as Jest and Selenium.
Iac: IaC: Infrastructure provisioning and management with Terraform and Ansible, ensuring the reproducibility and scalability of environments. Creation of custom modules to automate repetitive tasks.
Prometheus: Prometheus, Grafana – Configuration and customization of monitoring systems, dashboards, and alerts to ensure application availability and performance.
Redes: Networks: Knowledge of TCP/IP networks, configuration of routing and firewalls, VPNs, and network security practices.
Git: Git Versioning Control: Git GitHub GitLab – Advanced use of code versioning, branch management, pull requests and integration with CI/CD.
Github: Github code versioning, Using GitHub tools, such as GitHub Actions to automate workflows
Gitlab: GitLab Configuring runners to run pipelines on different platforms
